summary: This bill, the Department of Homeland Security Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties Act, amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002. It focuses on strengthening the role of the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties within the Department of Homeland Security (DHS). The bill mandates that the Secretary of Homeland Security assign permanent staff and resources to assist the Officer in their duties, ensuring they have the necessary support for their responsibilities related to civil rights and civil liberties. The bill also specifies that the officer is 'appointed pursuant to section 103(d)(3)'.
